title: BODE Index for COPD Survival
description: Predicts survival and mortality risk in patients with Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD). The BODE Index (Body-Mass Index, Obstruction, Dyspnea, Exercise) is a multidimensional grading system that better predicts survival than FEV1 alone.

parameters.name: fev1_percent_predicted
parameters.description: FEV1 as percentage of predicted normal value based on age, sex, height, and ethnicity

parameters.name: six_minute_walk_distance
parameters.description: Distance walked in meters during standardized 6-minute walk test

parameters.name: mmrc_dyspnea_scale
parameters.description: Modified Medical Research Council Dyspnea Scale assessing functional disability due to breathlessness

result.name: bode_index_score
result.description: BODE Index score from 0-10 points with survival predictions

ranges.interpretation: Lowest mortality risk with 80% 4-year survival rate. Patients in this quartile have relatively preserved lung function, exercise capacity, and minimal functional disability. Continue current management and monitor disease progression.

Moderate mortality risk with 67% 4-year survival rate. Patients show moderate impairment in multiple domains. Consider intensification of bronchodilator therapy, pulmonary rehabilitation, and regular monitoring.

High mortality risk with 57% 4-year survival rate. Significant impairment across multiple domains requiring comprehensive management including optimization of medical therapy, pulmonary rehabilitation, and consideration of oxygen therapy.

Very high mortality risk with only 18% 4-year survival rate. Severe disease with marked functional impairment. Requires aggressive management including oxygen therapy, consideration of lung volume reduction surgery or transplantation, and palliative care planning.

references: Celli BR, Cote CG, Marin JM, et al. The body-mass index, airflow obstruction, dyspnea, and exercise capacity index in chronic obstructive pulmonary disease. N Engl J Med. 2004 Mar 4;350(10):1005-12. doi: 10.1056/NEJMoa021322.
Ong KC, Earnest A, Lu SJ. A multidimensional grading system (BODE index) as predictor of hospitalization for COPD. Chest. 2005 Dec;128(6):3810-6. doi: 10.1378/chest.128.6.3810.
Cote CG, Celli BR. Pulmonary rehabilitation and the BODE index in COPD. Eur Respir J. 2005 Oct;26(4):630-6. doi: 10.1183/09031936.05.00045505.

Puhan MA, Garcia-Aymerich J, Frey M, et al. Expansion of the prognostic assessment of patients with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease: the updated BODE index and the ADO index. Lancet. 2009 Aug 29;374(9691):704-11. doi: 10.1016/S0140-6736(09)61301-5.
formula: BODE Index = FEV1 score + 6MWD score + mMRC score + BMI score. Total score ranges from 0-10 points with higher scores indicating worse prognosis.
notes: Not intended for use during acute COPD exacerbations - use only in stable patients
Does not guide specific treatment decisions but provides prognostic information
Should be used in conjunction with clinical judgment and other prognostic factors
FEV1 percentage predicted should be based on appropriate reference equations for patient demographics
6-minute walk test should be performed according to standardized protocols (ATS guidelines)
BMI component reflects the obesity paradox in COPD where lower BMI indicates worse prognosis
Originally developed and validated in outpatients with stable COPD
Has been validated across multiple populations and healthcare systems worldwide
